scenes.background: Monica raises her eyebrows, glancing at Bob with a skeptical look.
scenes.description: Monica says, 'Quick decisions are fine, but we also need to make sure we're on the same page. Thoughts?'

options.text: We could set up follow-up meetings to review and adjust our decisions if needed.
options.analysis: You propose a balanced approach that ensures quick decisions are not final and can be revised, showing good perception, empathy, and social skills.

options.text: I think sticking to quick decisions is key. We'll handle any misalignments as they occur.
options.analysis: You emphasize the importance of quick decisions and show confidence in dealing with any issues later, demonstrating good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: Rushing through decisions without proper alignment could be risky, let's slow down a bit.
options.analysis: You advocate for a more cautious approach, showing empathy and motivation, but less focus on self-regulation and perception.
